intro: Thoa acuta, commonly known as the sharp thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into capsule fruits. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Thoa acuta is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its distinctive appearance.
